svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
January 27, 2024" date: "2024-01-26"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade (meta EIP7569 )
* Final public testnets upgrade to Dencun Jan 30 (Sepolia) & Feb 7 (Holešky)
Lightweight beaconcha.in explorers: mainnet , Holešky & Sepolia
Final public testnets upgrade to Dencun Jan 30 (Sepolia) & Feb 7 (Holešky)
* Lightweight beaconcha.in explorers: mainnet , Holešky & Sepolia
* L2s testing blobs: RollCall (L2 standards) EIP4844 readiness call : L2s testing on
Goerli or waiting for Sepolia & improving communications with core devs OP & Base
devnets posting batches via blobs on Goerli testnet Starknet sent state diff blob on
Goerli testnet
L2s testing blobs:
* RollCall (L2 standards) EIP4844 readiness call : L2s testing on Goerli or waiting
for Sepolia & improving communications with core devs
RollCall (L2 standards) EIP4844 readiness call : L2s testing on Goerli or waiting for
Sepolia & improving communications with core devs
* OP & Base devnets posting batches via blobs on Goerli testnet
OP & Base devnets posting batches via blobs on Goerli testnet
* Starknet sent state diff blob on Goerli testnet
Starknet sent state diff blob on Goerli testnet
* Dencun interop testing call video : high memory usage after blob spamming, max churn
limit (EIP7514) will be tested on Goerli and first blobs expire on Goerli Feb 5
Dencun interop testing call video : high memory usage after blob spamming, max churn
* EF DevOps Attacknet : chaos testing tooling, plan to open source after Dencun
EF DevOps Attacknet : chaos testing tooling, plan to open source after Dencun
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
* Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
Electra upgrade scope (small cross layer fork targeting late 2024): Client team
priorities : Lighthouse , Lodestar & Prysm Electra EIPs : EIP6110 (validator deposits
onchain), EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits) & EIP7549 (move committee index outside
attestation) Not in Electra : EIP6914 (reuse validator indices) Discussions ongoing :
EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), EIP7547 (inclusion lists), EIP7594 (PeerDAS)
& SSZification EIPs
* Electra upgrade scope (small cross layer fork targeting late 2024): Client team
* Client team priorities : Lighthouse , Lodestar & Prysm
Client team priorities : Lighthouse , Lodestar & Prysm
* Electra EIPs : EIP6110 (validator deposits onchain), EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits)
& EIP7549 (move committee index outside attestation)
Electra EIPs : EIP6110 (validator deposits onchain), EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits) &
EIP7549 (move committee index outside attestation)
* Not in Electra : EIP6914 (reuse validator indices)
Not in Electra : EIP6914 (reuse validator indices)
* Discussions ongoing : EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), EIP7547 (inclusion
lists), EIP7594 (PeerDAS) & SSZification EIPs
Discussions ongoing : EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), EIP7547 (inclusion
Client releases for Sepolia & Holešky testnets Dencun upgrade
* Consensus layer: Lighthouse v4.6.0 Lodestar v1.15.0-rc.0 Nimbus v24.1.2 Prysm
Consensus layer:
* Lighthouse v4.6.0
Lighthouse v4.6.0
* Lodestar v1.15.0-rc.0
Lodestar v1.15.0-rc.0
* Nimbus v24.1.2
Nimbus v24.1.2
* Prysm v4.2.1-rc.2
Prysm v4.2.1-rc.2
* Teku v24.1.1
Teku v24.1.1
* Execution layer: Besu v24.1.1 Erigon v2.57.1 Geth v1.13.11 Nethermind v1.25.3 Reth
v0.1.0-alpha.16
Execution layer:
* Besu v24.1.1
Besu v24.1.1
* Erigon v2.57.1
Erigon v2.57.1
Geth v1.13.11
* Nethermind v1.25.3
Nethermind v1.25.3
* Reth
Reth
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* 🚨 Lido at 31.84% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
🚨 Lido at 31.84% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth 78%
supermajority, could cause a chain split & lose your staked ETH Allnodes & P2P
migrated to Besu Lido & Kiln reducing Geth usage Coinbase & Kraken “taking a look” at
client diversity Consensus layer: Prysm 39%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss
of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth 78% supermajority, could cause a chain split & lose your
staked ETH Allnodes & P2P migrated to Besu Lido & Kiln reducing Geth usage Coinbase &
Kraken “taking a look” at client diversity
Execution layer: Geth 78% supermajority, could cause a chain split & lose your staked
ETH
* Allnodes & P2P migrated to Besu
Allnodes & P2P migrated to Besu
* Lido & Kiln reducing Geth usage
Lido & Kiln reducing Geth usage
* Coinbase & Kraken “taking a look” at client diversity
Coinbase & Kraken “taking a look” at client diversity
* Consensus layer: Prysm 39%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm 39%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Layer 1
* Nethermind mainnet consensus issue on Jan 21, v1.23-1.25 were affected, patched
Nethermind mainnet consensus issue on Jan 21, v1.23-1.25 were affected, patched
* Data viz on whether we can increase the gas limit
Data viz on whether we can increase the gas limit
* Validator in-protocol consolidation in EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), to
allow large stakers to consolidate without having to fully exit validators & redeploy
Validator in-protocol consolidation in EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), to
Research
* Potential changes to staking rewards & penalties to reduce issuance moderately at
high staking levels
For stakers
* Rated list of solo stakers in CSV format (first 500k indices)
Support the Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense fund
The Biden administration is attempting to criminalize open source software development
as part of its war on crypto.
Donate to defend our innocent Ethereum heroes . Retweet to spread awareness .
Layer 2
* RARI L3 (Arbitrum Orbit) live, with NFT royalty enforcement
RARI L3 (Arbitrum Orbit) live, with NFT royalty enforcement
* Public Goods Network, Aevo & Lyra (OP Stack) changed to Optimiums (sidechain DA)
Public Goods Network, Aevo & Lyra (OP Stack) changed to Optimiums (sidechain DA)
EIPs/Standards
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7601 : Dapp permission framework ERC7602 : Ethereum
mixing transaction supervision ERC7603 : Context-dependent multi-asset tokens (ERC1155
extension)
* ERC7601 : Dapp permission framework
ERC7601 : Dapp permission framework
* ERC7602 : Ethereum mixing transaction supervision
ERC7602 : Ethereum mixing transaction supervision
* ERC7603 : Context-dependent multi-asset tokens (ERC1155 extension)
ERC7603 : Context-dependent multi-asset tokens (ERC1155 extension)
Stuff for developers
* Solidity v0.8.24 : Cancun support (via EVM version flag): tstore & tload transient
storage (EIP1153), blobhash & blobbasefee (EIP4844) and mcopy (EIP5656) Apple silicon
support
Solidity v0.8.24 :
* Cancun support (via EVM version flag): tstore & tload transient storage (EIP1153),
blobhash & blobbasefee (EIP4844) and mcopy (EIP5656)
Cancun support (via EVM version flag): tstore & tload transient storage (EIP1153),
* Apple silicon support
Apple silicon support
* Mutexer : Solidity mutexes (contract, function & custom level), using Cancun
transient storage (EIP1153)
Mutexer : Solidity mutexes (contract, function & custom level), using Cancun transient
storage (EIP1153)
* Forge proposal simulator : framework to create proposals (multisig, timelock &
Governor Bravo) and deployment scripts/tests
Forge proposal simulator : framework to create proposals (multisig, timelock &
* Ape (Python contract framework) custom network support
Ape (Python contract framework) custom network support
* CTFs: SmartSecRiddles : 7 challenges based on vulnerabilities with writeups Audit
wizard find the bug challenge
CTFs:
* SmartSecRiddles : 7 challenges based on vulnerabilities with writeups
SmartSecRiddles : 7 challenges based on vulnerabilities with writeups
* Audit wizard find the bug challenge
Audit wizard find the bug challenge
Security
* Concentric $1.7M exploit on Arbitrum using social engineering to compromise deployer
Ecosystem
* Academic paper on transparency & concentration in Ethereum governance
Academic paper on transparency & concentration in Ethereum governance
* Suggest a city for a future Devcon or Devconnect
Suggest a city for a future Devcon or Devconnect
Job Listings
* Status is hiring: Technical Chief Operating Officer - Apply here
Status is hiring: Technical Chief Operating Officer - Apply here
* Nethermind: Distributed System Engineer , Lead Engineer , Protocol Researcher
Nethermind: Distributed System Engineer , Lead Engineer , Protocol Researcher
* ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
* EF seek an Executive Assistant to support senior decision makers
EF seek an Executive Assistant to support senior decision makers
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 6.3 to 82.4 gwei, with 17.6 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 22.0 gwei 4k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 6.3 to 82.4 gwei, with 17.6 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 22.0 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 22.0 gwei
* 4k ETH net issuance this week
4k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $2,186 - $2,491, currently $2,267
ETHUSD : $2,186 - $2,491, currently $2,267
* ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.054 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Synthetix Perps v3 live on Base (Andromeda)
Synthetix Perps v3 live on Base (Andromeda)
* UMA Oval live on mainnet, protocols can capture oracle extractable value
UMA Oval live on mainnet, protocols can capture oracle extractable value
* 0x Tx Relay API live on mainnet, gasless swaps & approvals
0x Tx Relay API live on mainnet, gasless swaps & approvals
* Ethereum Attestation Service MetaMask Snap decodes EAS attestation data for signing
Ethereum Attestation Service MetaMask Snap decodes EAS attestation data for signing
Regulation/business/tokens
* SEC Twitter account compromised in January SIM swap had 2FA disabled since July 2023
General
* Support Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense via Juicebox fundraiser
Support Roman Storm & Alex Pertsev legal defense via Juicebox fundraiser
* USDT on Tron is majority of consumer stablecoin transactions & how Ethereum can
compete
USDT on Tron is majority of consumer stablecoin transactions & how Ethereum can
* Field Merkle Tree : commit multiple STARKs using binary Merkle Tree
Field Merkle Tree : commit multiple STARKs using binary Merkle Tree
* Apple fixed WebKit confusion zero day , update your devices
Apple fixed WebKit confusion zero day , update your devices
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-january-27-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Jan 30 – Sepolia testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 132608
Jan 30 – Sepolia testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 132608
* Feb 2-4 – ETH Cinco de Mayo hackathon (Cholula, Puebla)
Feb 2-4 – ETH Cinco de Mayo hackathon (Cholula, Puebla)
* Feb 3 – Ethereum Lima Day
Feb 3 – Ethereum Lima Day
* Feb 7 – Holešky testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 29696
Feb 7 – Holešky testnet Dencun upgrade epoch 29696
* Feb 23-Mar 3 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek & hackathon
Feb 23-Mar 3 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek & hackathon
* Mar 13-14 – ETHLatam (San Pedro Sula, Honduras)
Mar 13-14 – ETHLatam (San Pedro Sula, Honduras)
* Mar 15-17 – ETHGlobal London hackathon
Mar 15-17 – ETHGlobal London hackathon
* Mar 19-21 – ETH Canal (Panama City, Panamá) conference & hackathon
Mar 19-21 – ETH Canal (Panama City, Panamá) conference & hackathon
* Mar 21-24 – ETHTaipei conference & hackathon
Mar 21-24 – ETHTaipei conference & hackathon
* Mar 27-30 – ETH Bucharest hackathon & conference
Mar 27-30 – ETH Bucharest hackathon & conference
* Mar 29-31 – ETH Seoul hackathon
Mar 29-31 – ETH Seoul hackathon
* Apr 5-26 – ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum virtual hackathon
Apr 5-26 – ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum virtual hackathon
* Apr 5-7 – EthereumZuri.ch conference
Apr 5-7 – EthereumZuri.ch conference
* Apr 12-14 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
Apr 12-14 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
* May 3-5 – ETHGlobal Sydney hackathon
May 3-5 – ETHGlobal Sydney hackathon
* May 21-23 – DappCon (Berlin)
May 21-23 – DappCon (Berlin)
* May 24-26 – ETHBerlin hackathon
May 24-26 – ETHBerlin hackathon
* May 31-Jun 2 – ETHDublin hackathon & conference
May 31-Jun 2 – ETHDublin hackathon & conference
* May 31-Jun 2 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
May 31-Jun 2 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
* Jun 3-5 – ETH Belgrade conference
Jun 3-5 – ETH Belgrade conference
* Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels) conference
Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels) conference
* Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
* Jul 26-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
Jul 26-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
* Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
* Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
* Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
* Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
* Nov 15-17 – ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
Nov 15-17 – ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
